title.narrative: Phase VIII Multi sectoral emergency response for IDPs and vulnerable host communities in Yirol East

description.narrative: This will project build on CTP's Multi-sectoral Response programme supported by Irish Aid and others since 2017/18. The overall goal is to save lives, reduce suffering, maintain and protect human dignity. Ongoing programme surveys, HRP 2021, Yirol WASH Project Review Jun 2021, HPP Light Internal Review Nov 21 and HPP External Evaluation 2021 and the 2017 HPP and 2018 HPP Reviews show that humanitarian needs continue to be widespread and multi sectoral response is required to save lives. The project takes a nexus approach, combining humanitarian, development and peace approaches to address food insecurity, strengthened by improved coping mechanisms for women and girls, and safe water access. This project will equip communities with climate sensitive agroecological skills, tools and technology for long term food security beyond humanitarian food aid. An agroecological approach builds on traditional knowledge including context specific practices that regenerate the environment, improve biodiversity, increase resilience to shocks and manage pests at low or zero cost to farmers, combined with tools and seeds to increase productivity and production of diverse foods. A survivor-centred and women’s empowerment focused approach will support women to secure their safety and wellbeing, enabling them to recover, provide for their families and become food secure. The project will provide specialised GBV case management, WGSS, PSS, referral systems, dignity kits and socio-economic supports through access to livelihoods and VSLA to women and girls in Yirol East. To tackle poor access to safe water and poor hygiene/sanitation practices in the community, the project will provide safe water through borehole repair, establishing WUCs and training pump mechanics and distribution of hygiene items along with hygiene messaging. This project will be implemented by consortium of 3 local partners (TOCH, DMI and CDOR). DMI will implement VSLA component of the project.
